Pace One v1.5.0 Copyright Â© 2019 x5Bart Negative and positive splits Pace One km/h min/km PACE SPEED TIME DISTANCE hh:mm:ss km Clear Calculate DISTANCE SPEED TIME DISTANCE About Settings Exit SEGMENT split
A negative split is a racing strategy that involves completing the second half of a race faster than the first half. It is defined by the intentional setting of a slower initial pace, followed by a gradual or sudden increase of speed towards the end of the race. Conversely, the act of completing the first half of a race faster than the second half is known as a positive split. The strategy of negative splitting has been documented in competitive running since the early 20th century. Runners such as Steve Prefontaine, Wilson Kipsang and Galen Rupp have used them in races.
